text.0_Chapter, 0_Verse: NOW IN the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, that the word of the LORD by the mouth of Jeremiah might be accomplished, the LORD stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia, that he made a proclamation throughout all his kingdom, and put it also in writing, saying:
text.0_Chapter, 1_Verse: ’Thus saith Cyrus king of Persia: All the kingdoms of the earth hath the LORD, the God of heaven, given me; and He hath charged me to build Him a house in Jerusalem, which is in Judah.
text.0_Chapter, 2_Verse: Whosoever there is among you of all His people—his God be with him—let him go up to Jerusalem, which is in Judah, and build the house of the LORD, the God of Israel, He is the God who is in Jerusalem.
text.0_Chapter, 3_Verse: And whosoever is left, in any place where he sojourneth, let the men of his place help him with silver, and with gold, and with goods, and with beasts, beside the freewill-offering for the house of God which is in Jerusalem.’
text.0_Chapter, 4_Verse: Then rose up the heads of fathers’houses of Judah and Benjamin, and the priests, and the Levites, even all whose spirit God had stirred to go up to build the house of the LORD which is in Jerusalem.
text.0_Chapter, 5_Verse: And all they that were round about them strengthened their hands with vessels of silver, with gold, with goods, and with beasts, and with precious things, beside all that was willingly offered.
text.0_Chapter, 6_Verse: Also Cyrus the king brought forth the vessels of the house of the LORD, which Nebuchadnezzar had brought forth out of Jerusalem, and had put them in the house of his gods;
text.0_Chapter, 7_Verse: even those did Cyrus king of Persia bring forth by the hand of Mithredath the treasurer, and numbered them unto Sheshbazzar, the prince of Judah.
text.0_Chapter, 8_Verse: And this is the number of them: thirty basins of gold, a thousand basins of silver, nine and twenty knives;
text.0_Chapter, 9_Verse: thirty bowls of gold, silver bowls of a second sort four hundred and ten, and other vessels a thousand.
text.0_Chapter, 10_Verse: All the vessels of gold and of silver were five thousand and four hundred. All these did Sheshbazzar bring up, when they of the captivity were brought up from Babylon unto Jerusalem.
text.1_Chapter, 0_Verse: Now these are the children of the province, that went up out of the captivity of those that had been carried away, whom Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon had carried away unto Babylon, and that returned unto Jerusalem and Judah, every one unto his city;
text.1_Chapter, 1_Verse: who came with Zerubbabel, Jeshua, Nehemiah, Seraiah, Reelaiah, Mordecai, Bilshan, Mispar, Bigvai, Rehum, Baanah. The number of the men of the people of Israel: .
text.1_Chapter, 2_Verse: The children of Parosh, two thousand a hundred seventy and two.
text.1_Chapter, 3_Verse: The children of Shephatiah, three hundred seventy and two.
text.1_Chapter, 4_Verse: The children of Arah, seven hundred seventy and five.
text.1_Chapter, 5_Verse: The children of Pahath-moab, of the children of Jeshua and Joab, two thousand eight hundred and twelve.
text.1_Chapter, 6_Verse: The children of Elam, a thousand two hundred fifty and four.
text.1_Chapter, 7_Verse: The children of Zattu, nine hundred forty and five.
text.1_Chapter, 8_Verse: The children of Zaccai, seven hundred and threescore.
text.1_Chapter, 9_Verse: The children of Bani, six hundred forty and two.
text.1_Chapter, 10_Verse: The children of Bebai, six hundred twenty and three.
text.1_Chapter, 11_Verse: The children of Azgad, a thousand two hundred twenty and two.
text.1_Chapter, 12_Verse: The children of Adonikam, six hundred sixty and six.
text.1_Chapter, 13_Verse: The children of Bigvai, two thousand fifty and six.
text.1_Chapter, 14_Verse: The children of Adin, four hundred fifty and four.
text.1_Chapter, 15_Verse: The children of Ater, of Hezekiah, ninety and eight.
text.1_Chapter, 16_Verse: The children of Bezai, three hundred twenty and three.
text.1_Chapter, 17_Verse: The children of Jorah, a hundred and twelve.
text.1_Chapter, 18_Verse: The children of Hashum, two hundred twenty and three.
text.1_Chapter, 19_Verse: The children of Gibbar, ninety and five.
text.1_Chapter, 20_Verse: The children of Beth-lehem, a hundred twenty and three.
text.1_Chapter, 21_Verse: The men of Netophah, fifty and six.
text.1_Chapter, 22_Verse: The men of Anathoth, a hundred twenty and eight.
text.1_Chapter, 23_Verse: The children of Azmaveth, forty and two.
text.1_Chapter, 24_Verse: The children of Kiriath-arim, Chephirah, and Beeroth, seven hundred and forty and three.
text.1_Chapter, 25_Verse: The children of Ramah and Geba, six hundred twenty and one.
text.1_Chapter, 26_Verse: The men of Michmas, a hundred twenty and two.
text.1_Chapter, 27_Verse: The men of Beth-el and Ai, two hundred twenty and three.
text.1_Chapter, 28_Verse: The children of Nebo, fifty and two.
text.1_Chapter, 29_Verse: The children of Magbish, a hundred fifty and six.
text.1_Chapter, 30_Verse: The children of the other Elam, a thousand two hundred fifty and four.
text.1_Chapter, 31_Verse: The children of Harim, three hundred and twenty.
text.1_Chapter, 32_Verse: The children of Lod, Hadid, and Ono, seven hundred twenty and five.
text.1_Chapter, 33_Verse: The children of Jericho, three hundred forty and five.
text.1_Chapter, 34_Verse: The children of Senaah, three thousand and six hundred and thirty.
text.1_Chapter, 35_Verse: The priests: The children of Jedaiah, of the house of Jeshua, nine hundred seventy and three.
text.1_Chapter, 36_Verse: The children of Immer, a thousand fifty and two.
text.1_Chapter, 37_Verse: The children of Pashhur, a thousand two hundred forty and seven. .
text.1_Chapter, 38_Verse: The children of Harim, a thousand and seventeen.
text.1_Chapter, 39_Verse: The Levites: the children of Jeshua and Kadmiel, of the children of Hodaviah, seventy and four.
text.1_Chapter, 40_Verse: The singers: the children of Asaph, a hundred twenty and eight.
text.1_Chapter, 41_Verse: The children of the porters: the children of Shallum, the children of Ater, the children of Talmon, the children of Akkub, the children of Hatita, the children of Shobai, in all a hundred thirty and nine.
text.1_Chapter, 42_Verse: The Nethinim: the children of Ziha, the children of Hasupha, the children of Tabbaoth;
text.1_Chapter, 43_Verse: the children of Keros, the children of Siaha, the children of Padon;
text.1_Chapter, 44_Verse: the children of Lebanah, the children of Hagabah, the children of Akkub;
text.1_Chapter, 45_Verse: the children of Hagab, the children of Salmai, the children of Hanan;
text.1_Chapter, 46_Verse: the children of Giddel, the children of Gahar, the children of Reaiah;
text.1_Chapter, 47_Verse: the children of Rezin, the children of Nekoda, the children of Gazzam;
text.1_Chapter, 48_Verse: the children of Uzza, the children of Paseah, the children of Besai;
text.1_Chapter, 49_Verse: the children of Asnah, the children of Meunim, the children of Nephusim;
text.1_Chapter, 50_Verse: the children of Bakbuk, the children of Hakupha, the children of Harhur;
text.1_Chapter, 51_Verse: the children of Bazluth, the children of Mehida, the children of Harsha;
text.1_Chapter, 52_Verse: the children of Barkos, the children of Sisera, the children of Temah;
text.1_Chapter, 53_Verse: the children of Neziah, the children of Hatipha.
text.1_Chapter, 54_Verse: The children of Solomon’s servants: the children of Sotai, the children of Hassophereth, the children of Peruda;
text.1_Chapter, 55_Verse: the children of Jaalah, the children of Darkon, the children of Giddel;
text.1_Chapter, 56_Verse: the children of Shephatiah, the children of Hattil, the children of Pochereth-hazzebaim, the children of Ami.
text.1_Chapter, 57_Verse: All the Nethinim, and the children of Solomon’s servants, were three hundred ninety and two.
text.1_Chapter, 58_Verse: And these were they that went up from Tel-melah, Tel-harsa, Cherub, Addan, and Immer; but they could not tell their fathers’houses, and their seed, whether they were of Israel:
text.1_Chapter, 59_Verse: the children of Delaiah, the children of Tobiah, the children of Nekoda, six hundred fifty and two.
text.1_Chapter, 60_Verse: And of the children of the priests: the children of Habaiah, the children of Hakkoz, the children of Barzillai, who took a wife of the daughters of Barzillai the Gileadite, and was called after their name.
text.1_Chapter, 61_Verse: These sought their register, that is, the genealogy, but it was not found; therefore were they deemed polluted and put from the priesthood.
text.1_Chapter, 62_Verse: And the Tirshatha said unto them, that they should not eat of the most holy things, till there stood up a priest with Urim and with Thummim. .
text.1_Chapter, 63_Verse: The whole congregation together was forty and two thousand three hundred and threescore,
text.1_Chapter, 64_Verse: beside their men-servants and their maid-servants, of whom there were seven thousand three hundred thirty and seven; and they had two hundred singing men and singing women.
text.1_Chapter, 65_Verse: Their horses were seven hundred thirty and six; their mules, two hundred forty and five;
text.1_Chapter, 66_Verse: their camels, four hundred thirty and five; their asses, six thousand seven hundred and twenty.
text.1_Chapter, 67_Verse: And some of the heads of fathers’houses, when they came to the house of the LORD which is in Jerusalem, offered willingly for the house of God to set it up in its place;
text.1_Chapter, 68_Verse: they gave after their ability into the treasury of the work threescore and one thousand darics of gold, and five thousand pounds of silver, and one hundred priests’tunics.
text.1_Chapter, 69_Verse: So the priests, and the Levites, and some of the people, and the singers, and the porters, and the Nethinim, dwelt in their cities, and all Israel in their cities.
text.2_Chapter, 0_Verse: And when the seventh month was come, and the children of Israel were in the cities, the people gathered themselves together as one man to Jerusalem.
text.2_Chapter, 1_Verse: Then stood up Jeshua the son of Jozadak, and his brethren the priests, and Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and his brethren, and builded the altar of the God of Israel, to offer burnt-offerings thereon, as it is written in the Law of Moses the man of God.
text.2_Chapter, 2_Verse: And they set the altar upon its bases; for fear was upon them because of the people of the countries, and they offered burnt-offerings thereon unto the LORD, even burnt-offerings morning and evening.
text.2_Chapter, 3_Verse: And they kept the feast of tabernacles, as it is written, and offered the daily burnt-offerings by number, according to the ordinance, as the duty of every day required;
text.2_Chapter, 4_Verse: and afterward the continual burnt-offering, and the offerings of the new moons, and of all the appointed seasons of the LORD that were hallowed, and of every one that willingly offered a freewill-offering unto the LORD.
text.2_Chapter, 5_Verse: From the first day of the seventh month began they to offer burnt-offerings unto the LORD; but the foundation of the temple of the LORD was not yet laid.
text.2_Chapter, 6_Verse: They gave money also unto the hewers, and to the carpenters; and food, and drink, and oil, unto them of Zidon, and to them of Tyre, to bring cedar-trees from Lebanon to the sea, unto Joppa, according to the grant that they had of Cyrus king of Persia.
text.2_Chapter, 7_Verse: Now in the second year of their coming unto the house of God at Jerusalem, in the second month, began Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and Jeshua the son of Jozadak, and the rest of their brethren the priests and the Levites, and all they that were come out of the captivity unto Jerusalem; and appointed the Levites, from twenty years old and upward, to have the oversight of the work of the house of the LORD.
text.2_Chapter, 8_Verse: Then stood Jeshua with his sons and his brethren, and Kadmiel and his sons, the sons of Judah, together, to have the oversight of the workmen in the house of God; the sons of Henadad also, with their sons and their brethren the Levites.
text.2_Chapter, 9_Verse: And when the builders laid the foundation of the temple of the LORD, they set the priests in their apparel with trumpets, and the Levites the sons of Asaph with cymbals, to praise the LORD, according to the direction of David king of Israel.
text.2_Chapter, 10_Verse: And they sang one to another in praising and giving thanks unto the LORD: ‘for He is good, for His mercy endureth for ever toward Israel.’ And all the people shouted with a great shout, when they praised the LORD, because the foundation of the house of the LORD was laid.
text.2_Chapter, 11_Verse: But many of the priests and Levites and heads of fathers’houses, the old men that had seen the first house standing on its foundation, wept with a loud voice, when this house was before their eyes; and many shouted aloud for joy;
text.2_Chapter, 12_Verse: so that the people could not discern the noise of the shout of joy from the noise of the weeping of the people; for the people shouted with a loud shout, and the noise was heard afar off.
text.3_Chapter, 0_Verse: Now when the adversaries of Judah and Benjamin heard that the children of the captivity were building a temple unto the LORD, the God of Israel;
text.3_Chapter, 1_Verse: then they drew near to Zerubbabel, and to the heads of fathers’houses, and said unto them: ‘Let us build with you; for we seek your God, as ye do; and we do sacrifice unto Him since the days of Esarhaddon king of Assyria, who brought us up hither.’
text.3_Chapter, 2_Verse: But Zerubbabel, and Jeshua, and the rest of the heads of fathers’houses of Israel, said unto them: ‘Ye have nothing to do with us to build a house unto our God; but we ourselves together will build unto the LORD, the God of Israel, as king Cyrus the king of Persia hath commanded us.’
text.3_Chapter, 3_Verse: Then the people of the land weakened the hands of the people of Judah, and harried them while they were building,
text.3_Chapter, 4_Verse: and hired counsellors against them, to frustrate their purpose, all the days of Cyrus king of Persia, even until the reign of Darius king of Persia.
text.3_Chapter, 5_Verse: And in the reign of Ahasuerus, in the beginning of his reign, wrote they an accusation against the inhabitants of Judah and Jerusalem.
text.3_Chapter, 6_Verse: And in the days of Artaxerxes wrote Bishlam, Mithredath, Tabeel, and the rest of his companions, unto Artaxerxes king of Persia; and the writing of the letter was written in the Aramaic character, and set forth in the Aramaic tongue.
text.3_Chapter, 7_Verse: Rehum the commander and Shimshai the scribe wrote a letter against Jerusalem to Artaxerxes the king in this sort—
text.3_Chapter, 8_Verse: then wrote Rehum the commander, and Shimshai the scribe, and the rest of their companions; the Dinites, and the Apharesattechites, the Tarpelites, the Apharesites, the Archevites, the Babylonians, the Shushanchites, the Dehites, the Elamites,
text.3_Chapter, 9_Verse: and the rest of the nations whom the great and noble Asenappar brought over, and set in the city of Samaria, and the rest that are in the country beyond the River:— ‘And now—
text.3_Chapter, 10_Verse: this is the copy of the letter that they sent unto him, even unto Artaxerxes the king—thy servants the men beyond the River—and now
text.3_Chapter, 11_Verse: be it known unto the king, that the Jews that came up from thee are come to us unto Jerusalem; they are building the rebellious and the bad city, and have finished the walls, and are digging out the foundations.
text.3_Chapter, 12_Verse: Be it known now unto the king, that, if this city be builded, and the walls finished, they will not pay tribute, impost, or toll, and so thou wilt endamage the revenue of the kings.
text.3_Chapter, 13_Verse: Now because we eat the salt of the palace, and it is not meet for us to see the king’s dishonour, therefore have we sent and announced to the king,
text.3_Chapter, 14_Verse: that search may be made in the book of the records of thy fathers; so shalt thou find in the book of the records, and know that this city is a rebellious city, and hurtful unto kings and provinces, and that they have moved sedition within the same of old time; for which cause was this city laid waste.
text.3_Chapter, 15_Verse: We announce to the king that, if this city be builded, and the walls finished, by this means thou shalt have no portion beyond the River.’
text.3_Chapter, 16_Verse: Then sent the king an answer unto Rehum the commander, and to Shimshai the scribe, and to the rest of their companions that dwell in Samaria, and unto the rest beyond the River: ‘Peace, and now
text.3_Chapter, 17_Verse: the letter which ye sent unto us hath been plainly read before me.
text.3_Chapter, 18_Verse: And I decreed, and search hath been made, and it is found that this city of old time hath made insurrection against kings, and that rebellion and sedition have been made therein.
text.3_Chapter, 19_Verse: There have been mighty kings also over Jerusalem, who have ruled over all the country beyond the River; and tribute, impost, and toll, was paid unto them.
text.3_Chapter, 20_Verse: Make ye now a decree to cause these men to cease, and that this city be not builded, until a decree shall be made by me.
text.3_Chapter, 21_Verse: And take heed that ye be not slack herein; why should damage grow to the hurt of the kings?’
text.3_Chapter, 22_Verse: Then when the copy of king Artaxerxes’letter was read before Rehum, and Shimshai the scribe, and their companions, they went in haste to Jerusalem unto the Jews, and made them to cease by force and power.
text.3_Chapter, 23_Verse: Then ceased the work of the house of God which is at Jerusalem; and it ceased unto the second year of the reign of Darius king of Persia.
text.4_Chapter, 0_Verse: Now the prophets, Haggai the prophet, and Zechariah the son of Iddo, prophesied unto the Jews that were in Judah and Jerusalem; in the name of the God of Israel prophesied they unto them.
text.4_Chapter, 1_Verse: Then rose up Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and Jeshua the son of Jozadak, and began to build the house of God which is at Jerusalem; and with them were the prophets of God, helping them.
text.4_Chapter, 2_Verse: At the same time came to them Tattenai, the governor beyond the River, and Shethar-bozenai, and their companions, and said thus unto them: ‘Who gave you a decree to build this house, and to finish this structure?’
text.4_Chapter, 3_Verse: ’Then spoke we unto them after this manner [, wrote they]: What are the names of the men that build this building?’
text.4_Chapter, 4_Verse: But the eye of their God was upon the elders of the Jews, and they did not make them cease, till the matter should come to Darius, and then answer should be returned by letter concerning it.
text.4_Chapter, 5_Verse: The copy of the letter that Tattenai, the governor beyond the River, and Shethar-bozenai, and his companions the Apharesachites, who were beyond the River, sent unto Darius the king;
text.4_Chapter, 6_Verse: they sent a letter unto him, wherein was written thus: ‘Unto Darius the king, all peace.
text.4_Chapter, 7_Verse: Be it known unto the king, that we went into the province of Judah, to the house of the great God, which is builded with great stones, and timber is laid in the walls, and this work goeth on with diligence and prospereth in their hands.
text.4_Chapter, 8_Verse: Then asked we those elders, and said unto them thus: Who gave you a decree to build this house, and to finish this wall?
text.4_Chapter, 9_Verse: We asked them their names also, to announce to thee, that we might write the names of the men that were at the head of them.
text.4_Chapter, 10_Verse: And thus they returned us answer, saying: We are the servants of the God of heaven and earth, and build the house that was builded these many years ago, which a great king of Israel builded and finished.
text.4_Chapter, 11_Verse: But because that our fathers had provoked the God of heaven, He gave them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, the Chaldean, who destroyed this house, and carried the people away into Babylon.
text.4_Chapter, 12_Verse: But in the first year of Cyrus king of Babylon, Cyrus the king made a decree to build this house of God.
text.4_Chapter, 13_Verse: And the gold and silver vessels also of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took out of the temple that was in Jerusalem, and brought them into the temple of Babylon, those did Cyrus the king take out of the temple of Babylon, and they were delivered unto one whose name was Sheshbazzar, whom he had made governor;
text.4_Chapter, 14_Verse: and he said unto him: Take these vessels, go, put them in the temple that is in Jerusalem, and let the house of God be builded in its place.
text.4_Chapter, 15_Verse: Then came the same Sheshbazzar, and laid the foundations of the house of God which is in Jerusalem; and since that time even until now hath it been in building, and yet it is not completed.
text.4_Chapter, 16_Verse: Now therefore, if it seem good to the king, let search be made in the king’s treasure-house there, which is at Babylon, whether it be so, that a decree was made of Cyrus the king to build this house of God at Jerusalem, and let the king send his pleasure to us concerning this matter.’
text.5_Chapter, 0_Verse: Then Darius the king made a decree, and search was made in the house of the archives, where the treasures were laid up, in Babylon.
text.5_Chapter, 1_Verse: And there was found at Ahmetha, in the palace that is in the province of Media, a roll, and therein was thus written: ‘A record.
text.5_Chapter, 2_Verse: In the first year of Cyrus the king, Cyrus the king made a decree: Concerning the house of God at Jerusalem, let the house be builded, the place where they offer sacrifices, and let the foundations thereof be strongly laid; the height thereof threescore cubits, and the breadth thereof threescore cubits;
text.5_Chapter, 3_Verse: with three rows of great stones, and a row of new timber, and let the expenses be given out of the king’s house;
text.5_Chapter, 4_Verse: and also let the gold and silver vessels of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took forth out of the temple which is at Jerusalem, and brought unto Babylon, be restored, and brought back unto the temple which is at Jerusalem, every one to its place, and thou shalt put them in the house of God.’
text.5_Chapter, 5_Verse: ’Now therefore, Tattenai, governor beyond the River, Shethar-bozenai, and your companions the Apharesachites, who are beyond the River, be ye far from thence;
text.5_Chapter, 6_Verse: let the work of this house of God alone; let the governor of the Jews and the elders of the Jews build this house of God in its place.
text.5_Chapter, 7_Verse: Moreover I make a decree concerning what ye shall do to these elders of the Jews for the building of this house of God; that of the king’s goods, even of the tribute beyond the River, expenses be given with all diligence unto these men, that they be not hindered.
text.5_Chapter, 8_Verse: And that which they have need of, both young bullocks, and rams, and lambs, for burnt-offerings to the God of heaven, wheat, salt, wine, and oil, according to the word of the priests that are at Jerusalem, let it be given them day by day without fail;
text.5_Chapter, 9_Verse: that they may offer sacrifices of sweet savour unto the God of heaven, and pray for the life of the king, and of his sons.
text.5_Chapter, 10_Verse: Also I have made a decree, that whosoever shall alter this word, let a beam be pulled out from his house, and let him be lifted up and fastened thereon; and let his house be made a dunghill for this;
text.5_Chapter, 11_Verse: and may the God that hath caused His name to dwell there overthrow all kings and peoples, that shall put forth their hand to alter the same, to destroy this house of God which is at Jerusalem. I Darius have made a decree; let it be done with all diligence.’
text.5_Chapter, 12_Verse: Then Tattenai, the governor beyond the River, Shethar-bozenai, and their companions, because that Darius the king had thus sent, acted with all diligence.
text.5_Chapter, 13_Verse: And the elders of the Jews builded and prospered, through the prophesying of Haggai the prophet and Zechariah the son of Iddo. And they builded and finished it, according to the commandment of the God of Israel, and according to the decree of Cyrus, and Darius, and Artaxerxes king of Persia.
text.5_Chapter, 14_Verse: And this house was finished on the third day of the month Adar, which was in the sixth year of the reign of Darius the king.
text.5_Chapter, 15_Verse: And the children of Israel, the priests and the Levites, and the rest of the children of the captivity, kept the dedication of this house of God with joy.
text.5_Chapter, 16_Verse: And they offered at the dedication of this house of God a hundred bullocks, two hundred rams, four hundred lambs; and for a sin-offering for all Israel, twelve he-goats, according to the number of the tribes of Israel.
text.5_Chapter, 17_Verse: And they set the priests in their divisions, and the Levites in their courses, for the service of God, which is at Jerusalem; as it is written in the book of Moses.
text.5_Chapter, 18_Verse: And the children of the captivity kept the passover upon the fourteenth day of the first month.
text.5_Chapter, 19_Verse: For the priests and the Levites had purified themselves together; all of them were pure; and they killed the passover lamb for all the children of the captivity, and for their brethren the priests, and for themselves.
text.5_Chapter, 20_Verse: And the children of Israel, that were come back out of the captivity, and all such as had separated themselves unto them from the filthiness of the nations of the land, to seek the LORD, the God of Israel, did eat,
text.5_Chapter, 21_Verse: and kept the feast of unleavened bread seven days with joy; for the LORD had made them joyful, and had turned the heart of the king of Assyria unto them, to strengthen their hands in the work of the house of God, the God of Israel.
text.6_Chapter, 0_Verse: Now after these things, in the reign of Artaxerxes king of Persia, Ezra the son of Seraiah, the son of Azariah, the son of Hilkiah,
text.6_Chapter, 1_Verse: the son of Shallum, the son of Zadok, the son of Ahitub,
text.6_Chapter, 2_Verse: the son of Amariah, the son of Azariah, the son of Meraioth,
text.6_Chapter, 3_Verse: the son of Zerahiah, the son of Uzzi, the son of Bukki,
text.6_Chapter, 4_Verse: the son of Abishua, the son of Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the chief priest—
text.6_Chapter, 5_Verse: this Ezra went up from Babylon; and he was a ready scribe in the Law of Moses, which the LORD, the God of Israel, had given; and the king granted him all his request, according to the hand of the LORD his God upon him.
text.6_Chapter, 6_Verse: And there went up some of the children of Israel, and of the priests, and the Levites, and the singers, and the porters, and the Nethinim, unto Jerusalem, in the seventh year of Artaxerxes the king.
text.6_Chapter, 7_Verse: And he came to Jerusalem in the fifth month, which was in the seventh year of the king.
text.6_Chapter, 8_Verse: For upon the first day of the first month began he to go up from Babylon, and on the first day of the fifth month came he to Jerusalem, according to the good hand of his God upon him.
text.6_Chapter, 9_Verse: For Ezra had set his heart to seek the law of the LORD, and to do it, and to teach in Israel statutes and ordinances.
text.6_Chapter, 10_Verse: Now this is the copy of the letter that the king Artaxerxes gave unto Ezra the priest, the scribe, even the scribe of the words of the commandments of the LORD, and of His statutes to Israel:
text.6_Chapter, 11_Verse: ’Artaxerxes, king of kings, unto Ezra the priest, the scribe of the Law of the God of heaven, and so forth. And now
text.6_Chapter, 12_Verse: I make a decree, that all they of the people of Israel, and their priests and the Levites, in my realm, that are minded of their own free will to go with thee to Jerusalem, go.
text.6_Chapter, 13_Verse: Forasmuch as thou art sent of the king and his seven counsellors, to inquire concerning Judah and Jerusalem, according to the law of thy God which is in thy hand;
text.6_Chapter, 14_Verse: and to carry the silver and gold, which the king and his counsellors have freely offered unto the God of Israel, whose habitation is in Jerusalem,
text.6_Chapter, 15_Verse: and all the silver and gold that thou shalt find in all the province of Babylon, with the freewill-offering of the people, and of the priests, offering willingly for the house of their God which is in Jerusalem;
text.6_Chapter, 16_Verse: therefore thou shalt with all diligence buy with this money bullocks, rams, lambs, with their meal-offerings and their drink-offerings, and shalt offer them upon the altar of the house of your God which is in Jerusalem.
text.6_Chapter, 17_Verse: And whatsoever shall seem good to thee and to thy brethren to do with the rest of the silver and the gold, that do ye after the will of your God.
text.6_Chapter, 18_Verse: And the vessels that are given thee for the service of the house of thy God, deliver thou before the God of Jerusalem.
text.6_Chapter, 19_Verse: And whatsoever more shall be needful for the house of thy God, which thou shalt have occasion to bestow, bestow it out of the king’s treasure-house.
text.6_Chapter, 20_Verse: And I, even I Artaxerxes the king, do make a decree to all the treasurers that are beyond the River, that whatsoever Ezra the priest, the scribe of the Law of the God of heaven, shall require of you, it be done with all diligence,
text.6_Chapter, 21_Verse: unto a hundred talents of silver, and to a hundred measures of wheat, and to a hundred baths of wine, and to a hundred baths of oil, and salt without prescribing how much.
text.6_Chapter, 22_Verse: Whatsoever is commanded by the God of heaven, let it be done exactly for the house of the God of heaven; for why should there be wrath against the realm of the king and his sons?
text.6_Chapter, 23_Verse: Also we announce to you, that touching any of the priests and Levites, the singers, porters, Nethinim, or servants of this house of God, it shall not be lawful to impose tribute, impost, or toll, upon them.
text.6_Chapter, 24_Verse: And thou, Ezra, after the wisdom of thy God that is in thy hand, appoint magistrates and judges, who may judge all the people that are beyond the River, all such as know the laws of thy God; and teach ye him that knoweth them not.
text.6_Chapter, 25_Verse: And whosoever will not do the law of thy God, and the law of the king, let judgment be executed upon him with all diligence, whether it be unto death, or to banishment, or to confiscation of goods, or to imprisonment.’ .
text.6_Chapter, 26_Verse: Blessed be the LORD, the God of our fathers, who hath put such a thing as this in the king’s heart, to beautify the house of the LORD which is in Jerusalem;
text.6_Chapter, 27_Verse: and hath extended mercy unto me before the king, and his counsellors, and before all the king’s mighty princes. And I was strengthened according to the hand of the LORD my God upon me, and I gathered together out of Israel chief men to go up with me.
text.7_Chapter, 0_Verse: Now these are the heads of their fathers’houses, and this is the genealogy of them that went up with me from Babylon, in the reign of Artaxerxes the king.
text.7_Chapter, 1_Verse: Of the sons of Phinehas, Gershom; of the sons of Ithamar, Daniel; of the sons of David, Hattush.
text.7_Chapter, 2_Verse: Of the sons of Shecaniah: of the sons of Parosh, Zechariah; and with him were reckoned by genealogy of the males a hundred and fifty.
text.7_Chapter, 3_Verse: Of the sons of Pahath-moab, Eliehoenai the son of Zerahiah; and with him two hundred males.
text.7_Chapter, 4_Verse: Of the sons of Shechaniah, the son of Jahaziel; and with him three hundred males.
text.7_Chapter, 5_Verse: And of the sons of Adin, Ebed the son of Jonathan; and with him fifty males.
text.7_Chapter, 6_Verse: And of the sons of Elam, Jeshaiah the son of Athaliah; and with him seventy males.
text.7_Chapter, 7_Verse: And of the sons of Shephatiah, Zebadiah the son of Michael; and with him fourscore males.
text.7_Chapter, 8_Verse: Of the sons of Joab, Obadiah the son of Jehiel; and with him two hundred and eighteen males.
text.7_Chapter, 9_Verse: And of the sons of Shelomith, the son of Josiphiah; and with him a hundred and threescore males.
text.7_Chapter, 10_Verse: And of the sons of Bebai, Zechariah the son of Bebai; and with him twenty and eight males.
text.7_Chapter, 11_Verse: And of the sons of Azgad, Johanan the son of Hakkatan; and with him a hundred and ten males.
text.7_Chapter, 12_Verse: And of the sons of Adonikam, that were the last; and these are their names, Eliphelet, Jeiel, and Shemaiah; and with them threescore males.
text.7_Chapter, 13_Verse: And of the sons of Bigvai, Uthai and Zaccur; and with him seventy males.
text.7_Chapter, 14_Verse: And I gathered them together to the river that runneth to Ahava; and there we encamped three days; and I viewed the people, and the priests, and found there none of the sons of Levi.
text.7_Chapter, 15_Verse: Then sent I for Eliezer, for Ariel, for Shemaiah, and for Elnathan, and for Jarib, and for Elnathan, and for Nathan, and for Zechariah, and for Meshullam, chief men; also for Joiarib, and for Elnathan, teachers.
text.7_Chapter, 16_Verse: And I gave them commandment unto Iddo the chief at the place Casiphia; and I told them what they should say unto Iddo [and] his brother, who were set over the place Casiphia, that they should bring unto us ministers for the house of our God.
text.7_Chapter, 17_Verse: And according to the good hand of our God upon us they brought us a man of discretion, of the sons of Mahli, the son of Levi, the son of Israel; and Sherebiah, with his sons and his brethren, eighteen;
text.7_Chapter, 18_Verse: and Hashabiah, and with him Jeshaiah of the sons of Merari, his brethren and their sons, twenty;
text.7_Chapter, 19_Verse: and of the Nethinim, whom David and the princes had given for the service of the Levites, two hundred and twenty Nethinim; all of them were mentioned by name.
text.7_Chapter, 20_Verse: Then I proclaimed a fast there, at the river Ahava, that we might humble ourselves before our God, to seek of Him a straight way, for us, and for our little ones, and for all our substance.
text.7_Chapter, 21_Verse: For I was ashamed to ask of the king a band of soldiers and horsemen to help us against the enemy in the way; because we had spoken unto the king, saying: ‘The hand of our God is upon all them that seek Him, for good; but His power and His wrath is against all them that forsake Him.’
text.7_Chapter, 22_Verse: So we fasted and besought our God for this; and He was entreated of us.
text.7_Chapter, 23_Verse: Then I separated twelve of the chiefs of the priests, besides Sherebiah, Hashabiah, and ten of their brethren with them,
text.7_Chapter, 24_Verse: and weighed unto them the silver, and the gold, and the vessels, even the offering for the house of our God, which the king, and his counsellors, and his princes, and all Israel there present, had offered;
text.7_Chapter, 25_Verse: I even weighed into their hand six hundred and fifty talents of silver, and silver vessels a hundred talents; of gold a hundred talents;
text.7_Chapter, 26_Verse: and twenty bowls of gold, of a thousand darics; and two vessels of fine bright brass, precious as gold.
text.7_Chapter, 27_Verse: And I said unto them: ‘Ye are holy unto the LORD, and the vessels are holy; and the silver and the gold are a freewill-offering unto the LORD, the God of your fathers.
text.7_Chapter, 28_Verse: Watch ye, and keep them, until ye weigh them before the chiefs of the priests and the Levites, and the princes of the fathers’houses of Israel, at Jerusalem, in the chambers of the house of the LORD.’
text.7_Chapter, 29_Verse: So the priests and the Levites received the weight of the silver and the gold, and the vessels, to bring them to Jerusalem unto the house of our God.
text.7_Chapter, 30_Verse: Then we departed from the river of Ahava on the twelfth day of the first month, to go unto Jerusalem; and the hand of our God was upon us, and He delivered us from the hand of the enemy and lier-in-wait by the way.
text.7_Chapter, 31_Verse: And we came to Jerusalem, and abode there three days.
text.7_Chapter, 32_Verse: And on the fourth day was the silver and the gold and the vessels weighed in the house of our God into the hand of Meremoth the son of Uriah the priest; and with him was Eleazar the son of Phinehas; and with them was Jozabad the son of Jeshua, and Noadiah the son of Binnui, the Levites;
text.7_Chapter, 33_Verse: the whole by number and by weight; and all the weight was written at that time.
text.7_Chapter, 34_Verse: The children of the captivity, that were come out of exile, offered burnt-offerings unto the God of Israel, twelve bullocks for all Israel, ninety and six rams, seventy and seven lambs, twelve he-goats for a sin-offering; all this was a burnt-offering unto the LORD.
text.7_Chapter, 35_Verse: And they delivered the king’s commissions unto the king’s satraps, and to the governors beyond the River; and they furthered the people and the house of God.
text.8_Chapter, 0_Verse: Now when these things were done, the princes drew near unto me, saying: ‘The people of Israel, and the priests and the Levites, have not separated themselves from the peoples of the lands, doing according to their abominations, even of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Jebusites, the Ammonites, the Moabites, the Egyptians, and the Amorites.
text.8_Chapter, 1_Verse: For they have taken of their daughters for themselves and for their sons; so that the holy seed have mingled themselves with the peoples of the lands; yea, the hand of the princes and rulers hath been first in this faithlessness.’
text.8_Chapter, 2_Verse: And when I heard this thing, I rent my garment and my mantle, and plucked off the hair of my head and of my beard, and sat down appalled.
text.8_Chapter, 3_Verse: Then were assembled unto me every one that trembled at the words of the God of Israel, because of the faithlessness of them of the captivity; and I sat appalled until the evening offering.
text.8_Chapter, 4_Verse: And at the evening offering I arose up from my fasting, even with my garment and my mantle rent; and I fell upon my knees, and spread out my hands unto the LORD my God;
text.8_Chapter, 5_Verse: and I said: ‘O my God, I am ashamed and blush to lift up my face to Thee, my God; for our iniquities are increased over our head, and our guiltiness is grown up unto the heavens.
text.8_Chapter, 6_Verse: Since the days of our fathers we have been exceeding guilty unto this day; and for our iniquities have we, our kings, and our priests, been delivered into the hand of the kings of the lands, to the sword, to captivity, and to spoiling, and to confusion of face, as it is this day.
text.8_Chapter, 7_Verse: And now for a little moment grace hath been shown from the LORD our God, to leave us a remnant to escape, and to give us a nail in His holy place, that our God may lighten our eyes, and give us a little reviving in our bondage.
text.8_Chapter, 8_Verse: For we are bondmen; yet our God hath not forsaken us in our bondage, but hath extended mercy unto us in the sight of the kings of Persia, to give us a reviving, to set up the house of our God, and to repair the ruins thereof, and to give us a fence in Judah and in Jerusalem.
text.8_Chapter, 9_Verse: And now, O our God, what shall we say after this? for we have forsaken Thy commandments,
text.8_Chapter, 10_Verse: which Thou hast commanded by Thy servants the prophets, saying: The land, unto which ye go to possess it, is an unclean land through the uncleanness of the peoples of the lands, through their abominations, wherewith they have filled it from one end to another with their filthiness.
text.8_Chapter, 11_Verse: Now therefore give not your daughters unto their sons, neither take their daughters unto your sons, nor seek their peace or their prosperity for ever; that ye may be strong, and eat the good of the land, and leave it for an inheritance to your children for ever.
text.8_Chapter, 12_Verse: And after all that is come upon us for our evil deeds, and for our great guilt, seeing that Thou our God hast punished us less than our iniquities deserve, and hast given us such a remnant,
text.8_Chapter, 13_Verse: shall we again break Thy commandments, and make marriages with the peoples that do these abominations? wouldest not Thou be angry with us till Thou hadst consumed us, so that there should be no remnant, nor any to escape?
text.8_Chapter, 14_Verse: O LORD, the God of Israel, Thou art righteous; for we are left a remnant that is escaped, as it is this day; behold, we are before Thee in our guiltiness; for none can stand before Thee because of this.’
text.9_Chapter, 0_Verse: Now while Ezra prayed, and made confession, weeping and casting himself down before the house of God, there was gathered together unto him out of Israel a very great congregation of men and women and children; for the people wept very sore.
text.9_Chapter, 1_Verse: And Shecaniah the son of Jehiel, one of the sons of Elam, answered and said unto Ezra: ‘We have broken faith with our God, and have married foreign women of the peoples of the land; yet now there is hope for Israel concerning this thing.
text.9_Chapter, 2_Verse: Now therefore let us make a covenant with our God to put away all the wives, and such as are born of them, according to the counsel of the LORD, and of those that tremble at the commandment of our God; and let it be done according to the law.
text.9_Chapter, 3_Verse: Arise; for the matter belongeth unto thee, and we are with thee; be of good courage, and do it.’
text.9_Chapter, 4_Verse: Then arose Ezra, and made the chiefs of the priests, the Levites, and all Israel, to swear that they would do according to this word. So they swore.
text.9_Chapter, 5_Verse: Then Ezra rose up from before the house of God, and went into the chamber of Jehohanan the son of Eliashib; and when he came thither, he did eat no bread, nor drink water; for he mourned because of the faithlessness of them of the captivity.
text.9_Chapter, 6_Verse: And they made proclamation throughout Judah and Jerusalem unto all the children of the captivity, that they should gather themselves together unto Jerusalem;
text.9_Chapter, 7_Verse: and that whosoever came not within three days, according to the counsel of the princes and the elders, all his substance should be forfeited, and himself separated from the congregation of the captivity.
text.9_Chapter, 8_Verse: Then all the men of Judah and Benjamin gathered themselves together unto Jerusalem within the three days; it was the ninth month, on the twentieth day of the month; and all the people sat in the broad place before the house of God, trembling because of this matter, and for the great rain.
text.9_Chapter, 9_Verse: And Ezra the priest stood up, and said unto them: ‘Ye have broken faith, and have married foreign women, to increase the guilt of Israel.
text.9_Chapter, 10_Verse: Now therefore make confession unto the LORD, the God of your fathers, and do His pleasure; and separate yourselves from the peoples of the land, and from the foreign women.’
text.9_Chapter, 11_Verse: Then all the congregation answered and said with a loud voice: ‘As thou hast said, so it is for us to do.
text.9_Chapter, 12_Verse: But the people are many, and it is a time of much rain, and we are not able to stand without, neither is this a work of one day or two; for we have greatly transgressed in this matter.
text.9_Chapter, 13_Verse: Let now our princes of all the congregation stand, and let all them that are in our cities that have married foreign women come at appointed times, and with them the elders of every city, and the judges thereof, until the fierce wrath of our God be turned from us, as touching this matter.’
text.9_Chapter, 14_Verse: Only Jonathan the son of Asahel and Jahzeiah the son of Tikvah stood up against this matter; and Meshullam and Shabbethai the Levite helped them.
text.9_Chapter, 15_Verse: And the children of the captivity did so. And Ezra the priest, with certain heads of fathers’houses, after their fathers’houses, and all of them by their names, were separated; and they sat down in the first day of the tenth month to examine the matter.
text.9_Chapter, 16_Verse: And they were finished with all the men that had married foreign women by the first day of the first month.
text.9_Chapter, 17_Verse: And among the sons of the priests there were found that had married foreign women, namely: of the sons of Jeshua, the son of Jozadak, and his brethren, Maaseiah, and Eliezer, and Jarib, and Gedaliah.
text.9_Chapter, 18_Verse: And they gave their hand that they would put away their wives; and being guilty, [they offered] a ram of the flock for their guilt.
text.9_Chapter, 19_Verse: And of the sons of Immer: Hanani and Zebadiah.
text.9_Chapter, 20_Verse: And of the sons of Harim: Maaseiah, and Elijah, and Shemaiah, and Jehiel, and Uzziah.
text.9_Chapter, 21_Verse: And of the sons of Pashhur: Elioenai, Maaseiah, Ishmael, Nethanel, Jozabad, and Elasah.
text.9_Chapter, 22_Verse: And of the Levites: Jozabad, and Shimei, and Kelaiah—the same is Kelita—Pethahiah, Judah, and Eliezer.
text.9_Chapter, 23_Verse: And of the singers: Eliashib; and of the porters: Shallum, and Telem, and Uri.
text.9_Chapter, 24_Verse: And of Israel: of the sons of Parosh: Ramiah, and Izziah, and Malchijah, and Mijamin, and Eleazar, and Malchijah, and Benaiah.
text.9_Chapter, 25_Verse: And of the sons of Elam: Mattaniah, Zechariah, and Jehiel, and Abdi, and Jeremoth, and Elijah.
text.9_Chapter, 26_Verse: And of the sons of Zattu: Elioenai, Eliashib, Mattaniah, and Jeremoth, and Zabad, and Aziza.
text.9_Chapter, 27_Verse: And of the sons of Bebai: Jehohanan, Hananiah, Zabbai, Athlai.
text.9_Chapter, 28_Verse: And of the sons of Bani: Meshullam, Malluch, and Adaiah, Jashub, and Sheal, and Ramoth.
text.9_Chapter, 29_Verse: And of the sons of Pahath-moab: Adna, and Chelal, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattaniah, Bezalel, and Binnui, and Manasseh.
text.9_Chapter, 30_Verse: And of the sons of Harim: Eliezer, Isshijah, Malchijah, Shemaiah, Shimeon;
text.9_Chapter, 32_Verse: Of the sons of Hashum: Mattenai, Mattattah, Zabad, Eliphelet, Jeremai, Manasseh, Shimei.
text.9_Chapter, 33_Verse: Of the sons of Bani: Maadai, Amram, and Uel;
text.9_Chapter, 42_Verse: Of the sons of Nebo: Jeiel, Mattithiah, Zabad, Zebina, Jaddai, and Joel, Benaiah.
text.9_Chapter, 43_Verse: All these had taken foreign wives; and some of them had wives by whom they had children.
